intro: Soliva lusitanica, commonly known as the Portuguese sainfoin, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its hairy stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer, followed by pod-like fruits containing several seeds. Soliva lusitanica is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid conditions. It is used in traditional herbal medicine and as a forage plant for livestock.
